Who would be Narendra Modi's first call after his happiest moment? PM answers - Hindustan Times
summary:
Who would be Narendra Modi's first call after his happiest moment? PM answers

Date: Jan 10, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

In his first podcast appearance, Prime Minister Narendra Modi shared that his mother would have been the first person he would call during his happiest moment. He reflected on significant events in his life and emphasized the importance of family.

  • PM Modi discussed personal moments, including a pivotal call to his mother after hoisting the Indian flag at Lal Chowk in Srinagar.
  • He recalled his experience during an attack on his convoy in Punjab and the emotional significance of the call.
  • Modi talked about his childhood, political challenges, and lessons learned along the way.
  • The Prime Minister acknowledged his humanity and the inevitability of making mistakes.
“For me, it was a moment of joy and I also thought that my mother would have been worried.” - PM Narendra Modi

This podcast marks an intimate look at Modi's thoughts on family, politics, and his life experiences.
newTitle: Narendra Modi Reflects on His Mother During Podcast

title: JEE Main 2025 City Intimation Slip released at jeemain.nta.nic.in; Direct link here - Moneycontrol
summary:
JEE Main 2025 City Intimation Slip Released

Date: January 10, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The National Testing Agency (NTA) has released the JEE Main 2025 City Allotment Slip for Session 1. Candidates can now check their allotted exam city on the official website jeemain.nta.nic.in.

  • JEE Main 2025 City Allotment Slip has been made available.
  • Candidates can download the slip from the official NTA website.
  • This slip includes important information about exam center locations.
“JEE Main 2025 City Allotment Slip OUT!”

For students appearing for JEE Main Session 1, this is crucial information regarding their exam schedule.
newTitle: JEE Main 2025 City Intimation Slip Released

title: Congress takes dig at PM Modi over ‘I'm not a God' remark in podcast with Nikhil Kamath - Hindustan Times
summary:
Congress Criticizes PM Modi for His 'I'm Not a God' Comment in Recent Podcast

Date: Jan 10, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

In a recent podcast with Zerodha co-founder Nikhil Kamath, Prime Minister Narendra Modi stated, 'I am human who can make mistakes, not some God,' prompting a reaction from the Congress party.

  • The podcast aired on YouTube, where PM Modi discussed his past as Gujarat's chief minister.
  • Congress MP Jairam Ramesh criticized Modi's comment as a form of damage control.
  • Ramesh referred to Modi's previous assertion that he was 'sent by God' before the 2024 Lok Sabha elections.

Key Remarks from PM Modi

During the podcast, he emphasized, 'Everyone makes mistakes, including me,' contrasting earlier statements where he claimed divine inspiration for his actions.

“Until my mother was alive, I used to think I was born biologically... I am convinced that I was sent by God.”

The Congress party's response highlights ongoing political tensions as the elections approach.
newTitle: Congress Criticizes PM Modi for His 'I'm Not a God' Comment in Recent Podcast

Maha Kumbh goes digital: 2,700 CCTVs, AI to track crowd, underwater drones - The Indian Express
summary:
Maha Kumbh goes digital: 2,700 CCTVs, AI to track crowd, underwater drones

Publication Date: January 10, 2025

Source: The Indian Express

This year's Maha Kumbh in Prayagraj features significant technological advancements with extensive use of CCTV and AI.

  • Over 2,750 CCTV cameras will monitor the festival grounds.
  • The initiative aims to manage the anticipated influx of 40 crore pilgrims.
  • Vijaypuri Bapu, a sadhu, faces challenges with internet connectivity affecting his use of Kumbh apps.
  • The Digi Kumbh initiative marks a substantial investment in digital infrastructure by the Uttar Pradesh government.
“I have been playing bhajans (hymns) and taking photos on my phone. Since there is no Internet, I cannot use any of the Kumbh apps,” says Vijaypuri Bapu.

The digital advancements aim to enhance safety and service at the Maha Kumbh mela, making it a technologically advanced gathering.
newTitle: Maha Kumbh Goes Digital with AI and Surveillance Technology

"I'm Only Human, Not God": PM Modi In Podcast Debut With Zerodha Chief Nikhil Kamath - NDTV
summary:
I'm Only Human, Not God: PM Modi In Podcast Debut With Zerodha Chief Nikhil Kamath

Publication Date: New Delhi

Source: News Article

In his debut podcast appearance on Zerodha co-founder Nikhil Kamath's show, Prime Minister Narendra Modi acknowledged his flaws, stating, 'I too can make mistakes.' He comforted Kamath over his Hindi skills, emphasizing their shared understanding.

  • Prime Minister Modi discusses his humanity and the inevitability of mistakes.
  • Nikhil Kamath expresses concerns about his language skills due to his South Indian background.
  • The podcast covers Modi’s childhood, education, and challenges faced in politics.
  • PM Modi actively engages with Kamath, making the dialogue personal and relatable.
  • Modi shared a light-hearted anecdote about his childhood chores.
'Mistakes happen, and I too can make some. I am also a human, not god.' - PM Modi

Modi shared a heartfelt message with listeners, hoping they enjoyed the podcast as much as he did creating it.
newTitle: Prime Minister Modi Reflects on Human Experience in Podcast Debut

PM Narendra Modi makes podcast debut with Zerodha's Nikhil Kamath: Watch - Hindustan Times
summary:
PM Narendra Modi makes podcast debut with Zerodha's Nikhil Kamath: 'I am not a God'

Date: Jan 10, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

In his first podcast, PM Narendra Modi discusses integrity in politics and reflects on his past mistakes.

  • PM Narendra Modi acknowledged his podcast debut, responding, “This is my first podcast, I don't know how it'll go with your audience.”
  • Modi reflected on a previous speech from his tenure as Gujarat's chief minister, stating, “I said something in an insensitive way. Mistakes happen. I am human, not a God.”
  • “My first wish when I became CM was to invite all my school friends to CM House,” said PM Modi.
  • “I used to wash the clothes of all my family members. Because of that, I was allowed to go to the pond,” Modi on his childhood.
  • “One should enter politics with a mission, not with ambition,” Modi said.
“Mistakes happen. I am human, not a God.” - PM Narendra Modi

This podcast marks a significant moment for PM Modi as he shares insights and encourages integrity and mission-driven participation in politics.
newTitle: PM Narendra Modi makes podcast debut with Zerodha's Nikhil Kamath: 'I am not a God'

title: Class 3 female student of Zebar School in Thaltej dies of suspected cardiac arrest - DeshGujarat
summary:
Class 3 female student of Zebar School in Thaltej dies of suspected cardiac arrest

Date: Today
Source: DeshGujarat

In a tragic incident, a class 3 student at Zebar School for Children, Thaltej, has died after complaining of chest pain.

  • The student, Gargi Ranpara, was around 8-9 years old.
  • She arrived at school at 7:30 AM and collapsed on the stairs after complaining of chest pain.
  • The school staff performed CPR but could not revive her.
  • She was rushed to a nearby hospital, where she was declared dead.
  • Preliminary reports indicate cardiac arrest as the cause of death.
  • The school administration confirmed that Gargi had no prior history of cardiac issues.
  • The police are reviewing CCTV footage as part of their investigation.
“The cardiac arrest was sad and sudden,” stated the school’s administration.

This heartbreaking event has raised concerns about the health monitoring of students in schools.
newTitle: Tragic Incident: Class 3 Student Dies of Suspected Cardiac Arrest at Zebar School

title: Coldplay Concert: Bombay High Court Dismisses PIL Seeking Guidelines On Ticket Scalping - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Coldplay Concert: Bombay High Court Dismisses PIL Seeking Guidelines On Ticket Scalping

Date: 02 January 2024

Source: Live Law

The Bombay High Court has dismissed a Public Interest Litigation concerning ticket scalping and black marketing of concert tickets, stating the issue falls under police jurisdiction.

  • The court found the matter not suitable for judicial scrutiny.
  • Petitioners were advised to pursue other legal remedies such as filing an FIR or a consumer complaint.
  • The PIL addressed irregularities in ticket sales during a recent Coldplay concert on BookMyShow.
  • Petitioners argued that these practices hinder consumer rights and cause economic losses.
“Such practices have deprived consumers of their fundamental right to have equal opportunity of buying tickets and getting access to entertainment and live events.”

The dismissal of the PIL highlights ongoing concerns about ticket scalping and consumer rights in the entertainment sector.
newTitle: Bombay High Court Dismisses PIL on Concert Ticket Scalping

title: Boby Chemmanur moves Kerala High Court for bail in sexual harassment case - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Boby Chemmanur Seeks Bail in Kerala High Court Amid Sexual Harassment Case

Published on: 10 Jan 2025, 7:42 am, Source: Kerala High Court

Businessman Boby Chemmanur has applied for bail in the Kerala High Court following his arrest for a sexual harassment case filed by a Malayalam actress. His initial bail request was denied by a magistrate who found his comments to be inappropriate.

  • Chemmanur was arrested on January 8 and remanded for 14 days after his bail application was rejected.
  • The High Court will hear the case further on January 14, with the judge emphasizing that the case is not considered special.
  • The actress claims Chemmanur made inappropriate comments during a public event, exacerbating online harassment towards her.
  • Chemmanur's legal team argues the allegations are fabricated, pointing out delays in filing the complaint.
  • A key issue discussed was the potential bias of the magistrate who initially refused bail.
“There is no speciality for you. I have to give the prosecution time to get instructions.” – Justice PV Kunhikrishnan

The case raises significant questions about public comments and accountability, reflecting ongoing societal issues surrounding sexual harassment.
newTitle: Boby Chemmanur Seeks Bail in Kerala High Court Amid Sexual Harassment Case

title: BH Registered Vehicles Subject To Motor Vehicle Tax As Per State Law; Centre Can't Prescribe Tax Rates :... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Kerala High Court Ruling on BH Series Vehicle Tax Rates

Publication Date: (Date not provided) Source: Live Law

The Kerala High Court has ruled that the Central Government cannot enforce motor vehicle tax rates for Bharat (BH) registered vehicles, affirming that taxation on vehicles falls under state jurisdiction.

  • The Court held that the Central Government lacks authority to prescribe tax rates for BH vehicles.
  • BH registration was introduced to facilitate seamless transfer of vehicles across states.
  • The judgment responds to petitions from vehicle owners regarding tax payment for BH registration in Kerala.
  • The court specified that while principles for taxation can be set by the Centre, the rates must be determined by the states.
“The Central Government would not have the power to prescribe the rate of tax on motor vehicles,” the Court stated.

In conclusion, the Court emphasized that states can levy their own tax rates based on respective laws for BH registered vehicles, guided by the principles laid out by the Centre.
newTitle: Kerala High Court Ruling on BH Series Vehicle Tax Rates

title: India-Taliban talks: Region in flux and 5 reasons behind Delhi’s decision to engage Kabul - The Indian Express
summary:
India-Taliban Talks: Region in Flux and 5 Reasons Behind Delhi’s Decision to Engage Kabul

Publication Date: January 9, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

The meeting between Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri and Taliban Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi highlights India's approach to navigating complex geopolitical dynamics.

  • The meeting underscores India's national and security interests in the region.
  • No official recognition of the Taliban government is being considered yet.
  • Geopolitical shifts in the region are prompting India to engage cautiously.
  • India's humanitarian and development assistance to Afghanistan remains a facet of the discussions.
  • Ongoing concerns about Afghan security and its implications for India.
“This meeting is an effort by India to secure its own national and security interests with many moving parts in play.”

In conclusion, the talks signal India's strategic approach to a changing political landscape and reflect its ongoing commitment to Afghanistan amidst challenges.
newTitle: India-Taliban Talks: Reasons Behind Delhi’s Engagement with Kabul

Bombay High Court Takes Suo Motu Cognisance On Protection And Preservation Of Wetlands In State - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Bombay High Court Takes Suo Motu Cognisance On Protection And Preservation Of Wetlands In State

Date: 10 January 2025 Source: Live Law

The Bombay High Court has taken suo motu cognisance of the issue of wetlands preservation in Maharashtra, following a directive from the Supreme Court.

  1. The High Court acted based on a Supreme Court order regarding the maintenance of Ramsar Convention sites.
  2. It issued notices to the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change, Union of India, and state's environmental authorities.
  3. Senior Advocate Janak Dwarkadas has been appointed as amicus curiae to assist the Court.
  4. The next hearing is scheduled for 25 February 2025.
“The High Courts could take the assistance of amicus curiae if necessary.”

This action underscores the court's commitment to environmental protection and adherence to international conventions regarding wetlands.
newTitle: Bombay High Court Takes Action on Wetland Preservation
